bug.author: niuwenju
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
when i running the demo by python detect.py --source test.mp4 , got some errors as follows Fusing layers... Model Summary: 68 layers, 6.98694e+06 parameters, 6.98694e+06 gradients video 1/1 (1/720) D:\Desktop\hegui\111.mp4: Traceback (most recent call last): File "detect.py", line 173, in detect() File "detect.py", line 74, in detect pred = model(img, augment=opt.augment)[0] File "C:\Users
iuwj\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages	orch
n\modules\module.py", line 550, in call result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs) File "D:\Desktop	est\yolov5\models\yolo.py", line 113, in forward return self.forward_once(x, profile) # single-scale inference, train File "D:\Desktop	est\yolov5\models\yolo.py", line 133, in forward_once x = m(x) # run File "C:\Users
iuwj\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages	orch
n\modules\module.py", line 550, in call result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs) File "D:\Desktop	est\yolov5\models\yolo.py", line 40, in forward x[i] = self.mi # conv File "C:\Users
iuwj\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages	orch
n\modules\module.py", line 594, in getattr type(self).name, name)) AttributeError: 'Detect' object has no attribute 'm' <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
OS: Windows10 CPU python :3.6.8 python packages
Package Version <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
absl-py 0.10.0 altgraph 0.17 astor 0.8.1 astunparse 1.6.3 cachetools 4.1.1 certifi 2020.6.20 chardet 3.0.4 click 7.1.2 cycler 0.10.0 Cython 0.29.21 decorator 4.4.2 defusedxml 0.6.0 Flask 1.1.2 future 0.18.2 gast 0.2.2 google-auth 1.20.1 google-auth-oauthlib 0.4.1 google-pasta 0.2.0 graphviz 0.8.4 grpcio 1.31.0 h5py 2.10.0 idna 2.6 importlib-metadata 1.7.0 itsdangerous 1.1.0 Jinja2 2.11.2 Keras-Applications 1.0.8 Keras-Preprocessing 1.1.2 kiwisolver 1.2.0 Markdown 3.2.2 MarkupSafe 1.1.1 matplotlib 3.3.1 mxnet 1.3.1 networkx 2.5 numpy 1.19.1 oauthlib 3.1.0 onnx 1.7.0 opencv-python 4.4.0.42 opt-einsum 3.3.0 pefile 2019.4.18 Pillow 7.2.0 pip 18.1 protobuf 3.6.1 pyasn1 0.4.8 pyasn1-modules 0.2.8 pyinstaller 4.0 pyinstaller-hooks-contrib 2020.7 pyparsing 2.4.7 pypiwin32 223 python-dateutil 2.8.1 pywin32 228 pywin32-ctypes 0.2.0 PyYAML 5.3.1 redis 3.5.3 requests 2.24.0 requests-oauthlib 1.3.0 rsa 4.6 scipy 1.4.1 setuptools 50.0.0 six 1.15.0 tensorboard 2.2.0 tensorboard-plugin-wit 1.7.0 tensorflow 1.15.3 tensorflow-estimator 1.15.1 termcolor 1.1.0 test-generator 0.1.1 torch 1.5.1+cpu torchvision 0.6.1+cpu tqdm 4.48.2 typing-extensions 3.7.4.3 urllib3 1.22 Werkzeug 1.0.1 wheel 0.35.1 wrapt 1.12.1 zipp 3.1.0

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/niuwenju>@niuwenju</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Training Tutorial</denchmark-link> to get started, and see our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb>Jupyter Notebook</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/github/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb></denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5>Docker Image</denchmark-link> , and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/GCP-Quickstart>Google Cloud Quickstart Guide</denchmark-link> for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom model or data training question, please note Ultralytics does not provide free personal support. As a leader in vision ML and AI, we do offer professional consulting, from simple expert advice up to delivery of fully customized, end-to-end production solutions for our clients, such as:
Cloud-based AI systems operating on hundreds of HD video streams in realtime. Edge AI integrated into custom iOS and Android apps for realtime 30 FPS video inference. Custom data training, hyperparameter evolution, and model exportation to any destination.
For more information please visit <denchmark-link:https://www.ultralytics.com>https://www.ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> .
I don't know if it fixes it, but you need Python 3.8 or later
Make sure you satisfy the requirements (py > 3.8 and torch >1.6 + requirements.txt). Then please check <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/577>#577</denchmark-link> .
I met the same bug,you need to download suitable weight.pt,or you might let program auto download weight.pt for itself then bug gone.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
